actions-list.actionItem: The Committee of the Whole proceeded with three hours of general debate on H. Con. Res. 14.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Steve Womack to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 161 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 20, H.J. Res. 35 and H. Con. Res. 14. The resolution provides for consideration of two joint resolutions, H.J. Res. 20, under a closed rule and H.J. Res. 35, under a closed rule. Also, the resolution provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 14, under a closed rule. The joint resolutions are debated for one hour each and the concurrent resolution is debated for 3 hours.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 161. H. Con. Res. 14 — "Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 162 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 217
actions-list.actionItem: 211 (Roll no. 47).

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216
actions-list.actionItem: 210 (Roll no. 46).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 161 — "Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 20) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Consumer Gas-fired Instantaneous Water Heaters"; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 35) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Waste Emissions Charge for Petroleum and Natural Gas Systems: Procedures for Facilitating Compliance, Including Netting and Exemptions"; and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 14) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 25.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 161, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 161.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 161 — "Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 20) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Energy relating to "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Consumer Gas-fired Instantaneous Water Heaters"; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 35) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Waste Emissions Charge for Petroleum and Natural Gas Systems: Procedures for Facilitating Compliance, Including Netting and Exemptions"; and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 14) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2025 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2026 through 2034."

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276L, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the British-American Interparliamentary Group: Mrs. Kim, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Aderholt, Mr. Smucker, Mr. Cole and Mr. Kean.

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276d, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Canada-United States Interparliamentary Group: Mr. Huizenga, Chair.

actions-list.header: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 3003, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Co-Chair.

Pursuant to 36 U.S.C. 2302, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the United States Holocaust Memorial Council: Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Bacon and Mr. Miller of Ohio.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. LaMalfa to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 25.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Earl L. "Buddy" Carter to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
